## Pull Request Overview This PR implements the ingestion pipeline described in SPEC-002, providing standardized document processing with Unstructured (`partition(auto)`) and LlamaIndex `IngestionPipeline`, plus OCR fallback, deterministic IDs, PDF page image artifacts, and a local DuckDB-backed cache for idempotent, repeatable runs. Key changes include: - Unstructured `partition(auto)` with strategy mapping (hi_res/fast/ocr_only) and OCR fallback - LlamaIndex `IngestionPipeline` + `IngestionCache` using `DuckDBKVStore` - Deterministic node IDs via SHA-256 on normalized content and page image emission for PDFs ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 38 out of 38 changed files in this pull request and generated 5 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | src/processing/document_processor.py | Core ingestion logic with UnstructuredTransformation, strategy mapping, caching, and PDF page-image emission | | src/processing/pdf_pages.py | PDF page image rendering with stable filenames and bbox metadata | | src/processing/utils.py | Deterministic ID generation via SHA-256 normalization and hashing utilities | | src/models/schemas.py | PdfPageImageNode model and ErrorResponse enrichment | | tests/unit/processing/* | Unit tests for PDF pages, deterministic IDs, and document processor components | | tests/integration/test_ingestion_pipeline_pdf_images.py | Integration tests for PDF image emission and OCR fallback | | tests/integration/test_chunking_integration.py | Updated chunking tests with PDF page image patching | | tests/integration/test_settings_page.py | Settings page integration tests with LLM backend validation | | src/config/settings.py | Strict LLM backend validation (literal type enforcement) | | scripts/* | Updated script references and performance monitoring enhancements |

<issue_to_address>
Idempotent image writing may not update images if the source PDF changes.

Since images are only written if they don't exist, updates to the PDF won't be reflected in the output. Implement a check (such as comparing file hashes) to ensure images are refreshed when the PDF changes.

<issue_to_address>
Consider refactoring shared PDF rendering logic into a private helper function used by both public APIs to eliminate code duplication.

You can pull all of the ‚Äúopen‚Äêpdf ‚Üí render pages ‚Üí save if missing ‚Üí collect bbox‚Äù logic into one small helper, then have both public functions call it and just map its output to whatever shape they need:

```python
# new private helper
def _render_pdf_pages(
    pdf_path: Path, out_dir: Path, dpi: int = 180
) -> list[tuple[int, Path, fitz.Rect]]:
    out_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    zoom = dpi / 72.0
    mat = fitz.Matrix(zoom, zoom)
    results: list[tuple[int, Path, fitz.Rect]] = []
    with fitz.open(pdf_path) as doc:
        for i, page in enumerate(doc, start=1):
            img_name = f"{pdf_path.stem}__page-{i}.png"
            img_path = out_dir / img_name
            if not img_path.exists():
                page.get_pixmap(matrix=mat).save(str(img_path))
            results.append((i, img_path, page.rect))
    return results
```

Then simplify your two public functions to just call it:

```python
def save_pdf_page_images(
    pdf_path: Path, out_dir: Path, dpi: int = 180
) -> list[dict]:
    entries = _render_pdf_pages(pdf_path, out_dir, dpi)
    return [
        {
            "page_no": i,
            "image_path": str(path),
            "bbox": [float(rect.x0), float(rect.y0),
                     float(rect.x1), float(rect.y1)],
        }
        for i, path, rect in entries
    ]


def pdf_pages_to_image_documents(
    pdf_path: Path, dpi: int = 180
) -> tuple[list[ImageDocument], Path]:
    out_dir = Path(tempfile.mkdtemp(prefix=uuid.uuid4().hex))
    entries = _render_pdf_pages(pdf_path, out_dir, dpi)
    docs = [
        ImageDocument(
            image_path=str(path),
            metadata={
                "page": i,
                "modality": "pdf_page_image",
                "source": str(pdf_path),
            },
        )
        for i, path, _ in entries
    ]
    return docs, out_dir
```

This removes all duplication while preserving both APIs.
</issue_to_address>
